info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Macon, Transylvania, southwestern Henderson, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Greenville, northern Pickens and north central Oconee Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Brevard, or near Lake Toxaway, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brevard, Etowah, Rosman, Cashiers, Lake Toxaway, Looking Glass, Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Lake Glenville and Jones Gap State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
